results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection
results.creator_credit: Hideaki Anno, Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Project EVA, Gainax and TV Tokyo
results.brief_description: Set in 2015, in a post-holocaust world, with half the population annihilated, this made for television animated series mixes science fiction, action, mystery and adventure with humour. Evangelion is the name of the most powerful combat weapon ever made by man, but one that requires a young human pilot to manipulate it. As the human race cowers in subterranean cities, a deadly war is raged between survivors and the mysterious beings known as Angels. As the Angels and the Evangelions engage in deadly battle, the mystery of why the earth was attacked remains unsolved.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hideaki Anno, Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Project EVA, Gainax and TV Tokyo

results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection 0:7 Eps. 21-23
results.creator_credit: Hideaki Anno, Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Project EVA, Gainax and TV Tokyo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection”.
Set in 2015, in a post-holocaust world, with half the population annihilated, this made for television animated series mixes science fiction, action, mystery and adventure with humour. Evangelion is the name of the most powerful combat weapon ever made by man, but one that requires a young human pilot to manipulate it. A triple-cross leaves the fate of mankind hanging in the balance as the Evangelions must once again defend the earth against Angels. With the world in extreme danger, Rei must make a terrible sacrifice in order to save NERV once more. This disc, Collection 0:7, contains episodes 21-23.

results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection 0:4. Eps 12-14
results.creator_credit: Hideaki Anno, Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Project EVA, Gainax and TV Tokyo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection”.
Set in 2015, in a post-holocaust world, with half the population annihilated, this made for television animated series mixes science fiction, action, mystery and adventure with humour. Evangelion is the name of the most powerful combat weapon ever made by man, but one that requires a young human pilot to manipulate it. The war for the fate of mankind shifts to a new field of battle as a promotion for Misato sparks an introspective review of the events behind her early recruitment into NERV. Against a fresh wave of attacks, Shinji and Misato much face up to their conflicted feelings for their respective fathers, whilst trying to save the earth from destruction. This disc, Collection 0:4, contains episodes 12-14.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hideaki Anno, Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Project EVA, Gainax and TV Tokyo

Against a fresh wave of attacks, Shinji and Misato much face up to their conflicted feelings for their respective fathers, whilst trying to save the earth from destruction. This disc, Collection 0:4, contains episodes 12-14.

results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection 0:3. Eps. 09-11
results.creator_credit: Hideaki Anno, Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Project EVA, Gainax and TV Tokyo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection”.
Set in 2015, in a post-holocaust world, with half the population annihilated, this made for television animated series mixes science fiction, action, mystery and adventure with humour. Evangelion is the name of the most powerful combat weapon ever made by man, but one that requires a young human pilot to manipulate it. As the Angels continue their assault, the forces of NERV are finding it difficult to combat the fresh waves of devastation. When an unborn Angel is found incubating inside an active volcano, a cataclysmic confrontation is imminent. This disc, Collection 0:3, contains episodes 9-11.

results.creator_credit: Hideaki Anno, Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Project EVA, Gainax and TV Tokyo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection”.
Set in 2015, in a post-holocaust world, with half the population annihilated, this made for television animated series mixes science fiction, action, mystery and adventure with humour. Evangelion is the name of the most powerful combat weapon ever made by man, but one that requires a young human pilot to manipulate it. As the human race cowers in subterranean cities, a deadly war is raged between survivors and the mysterious beings known as Angels. As the Angels and the Evangelions engage in deadly battle, the mystery of why the earth was attacked remains unsolved. This disc, Collection 0:1, contains episodes 1-4. Also available on VHS [309090].

results.title: Neighbours (the remix): 2004 New Visual Cultures
results.brief_description: A half-hour program that references the global success of the soap-opera Neighbours. Consisting of three nine-minute segments by an emerging documentarian, an emerging fiction moving image maker, and by a visual artist, Neighbours (the remix) will playfully subvert and imaginatively redraw the landscape of Australia suburbia. As part of Neighbours (the remix) there will be interspersed ad-breaks (30 second duration each) by six leading, established Australian art practitioners.
results.description: A half-hour program that references the global success of the soap-opera Neighbours. As part of Neighbours (the remix) there will be interspersed ad-breaks (30 second duration each) by six leading, established Australian art practitioners.

Neighbours (the remix) - Joel Anderson (Better than Eden)
Neighbours (the remix) - Katrina Sawyer (Decent, generous, tolerant, open minded [white] people)

results.title: Neighbours (the remix) - Raafat Ishak (Labrador #2)
results.brief_description: Labrador #2 follows on from Ocular Lab’s original exhibition, Labrador, and is a collaborative experiment investigating what neighbourly relevance there is, if any, amongst its participants and the broader art community. It also takes a critical look at ACMI and NGV: Australia at Federation Square and these institutions’ relationship - neighbourly, or otherwise.

results.title: Neighbours (the remix) - Destiny Deacon (Over d-Fence)
results.brief_description: A half-hour program that references the global success of the soap-opera Neighbours. Consisting of three nine-minute segments by an emerging documentarian, an emerging fiction moving image maker, and by a visual artist, Neighbours (the remix) will playfully subvert and imaginatively redraw the landscape of Australia suburbia. As part of Neighbours (the remix) there will be interspersed ad-breaks (30 second duration each) by five leading, established art practitioners.
